intro: Centaurium pulchellum f. album, commonly known as the white centaury, is a flowering plant characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and delicate white to pale pink flowers. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is native to regions of Europe and western Asia. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in meadows and woodland edges. Its flowers are tubular with five lobes and are often visited by bees and other pollinators. The foliage consists of opposite, linear leaves that are often hairy.
